field.name: summary
field.value: AbstractHelper.ScriptBlock: generated code does not pass XHTML validation

field.name: description
field.value:
As mentioned in http://groups.google.de/group/castle-project-devel/browse_thread/thread/e3cdba5e04aa8a6e
The code generated by AbstractHelper.ScriptBlock does not pass XHTML validation if the JS code contains the characters & or <. One solution is to enclose the JS code in /*<![CDATA[*/ and /*]]>*/
The CDATA block causes the XHTML validator to not interpret the special characters within the JS code as XML. Putting it within a comment ensures compatibility with non-XHTML capable browsers.
The attached patch fixes ScriptBlock() and the unit tests depending on it.
